trans-unit.source: Returns information about the performance of a network connection resource

seg-source.mrk: Returns information about the performance of a network connection resource

target.mrk: Returns information about the performance of a network connection resource

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Name of a local device, such as "F:" or "LPT1", that is redirected to a network resource to be queried.

seg-source.mrk: Name of a local device, such as "F:" or "LPT1", that is redirected to a network resource to be queried.

target.mrk: Name of a local device, such as "F:" or "LPT1", that is redirected to a network resource to be queried.

trans-unit.source: If blank, the network resource is specified in $sRemoteName.

seg-source.mrk: If blank, the network resource is specified in $sRemoteName.

target.mrk: If blank, the network resource is specified in $sRemoteName.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter specifies a local device $sRemoteName is ignored.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter specifies a local device $sRemoteName is ignored.

target.mrk: If this parameter specifies a local device $sRemoteName is ignored.

trans-unit.source: Name of the network resource to query.

seg-source.mrk: Name of the network resource to query.

target.mrk: Name of the network resource to query.

trans-unit.source: The resource must currently have an established connection.

seg-source.mrk: The resource must currently have an established connection.

target.mrk: The resource must currently have an established connection.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the resource is a file on a file server, then having the file open will ensure the connection.

seg-source.mrk: For example, if the resource is a file on a file server, then having the file open will ensure the connection.

target.mrk: For example, if the resource is a file on a file server, then having the file open will ensure the connection.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: an array with the following format:

target.mrk: an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[0] - Connection description. Can be one of more of the following:

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[0] - Connection description.
Can be one of more of the following:

target.mrk: $aInfo[0] - Connection description.
Can be one of more of the following:

trans-unit.source: 1 - The information returned applies to the performance of the network card

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The information returned applies to the performance of the network card

target.mrk: 1 - The information returned applies to the performance of the network card

trans-unit.source: 2 - The connection is not being routed

seg-source.mrk: 2 - The connection is not being routed

target.mrk: 2 - The connection is not being routed

trans-unit.source: 4 - The connection is over a medium that is typically slow

seg-source.mrk: 4 - The connection is over a medium that is typically slow

target.mrk: 4 - The connection is over a medium that is typically slow

trans-unit.source: 8 - Some of the information returned is calculated dynamically

seg-source.mrk: 8 - Some of the information returned is calculated dynamically

target.mrk: 8 - Some of the information returned is calculated dynamically

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[1] - Speed of the media to the network resource, in 100 bps

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[1] - Speed of the media to the network resource, in 100 bps

target.mrk: $aInfo[1] - Speed of the media to the network resource, in 100 bps

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[2] - One-way delay time introduced when sending information

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[2] - One-way delay time introduced when sending information

target.mrk: $aInfo[2] - One-way delay time introduced when sending information

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[3] - Size of data that an application should use when making a single request to the resource

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[3] - Size of data that an application should use when making a single request to the resource

target.mrk: $aInfo[3] - Size of data that an application should use when making a single request to the resource

trans-unit.source: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: See Also

target.mrk: See Also
